column4: anyone know how paper size is controlled in ubuntu?  /etc/papersize does nothing, and configuring cups via gnome gui does nothing ... any tips?
go to the website of cups daemon
i.e. localhost:631
uhh yes you can go there then click on manage printers then go to configure printer the paper size is right there
look in /etc/cups/cupsd.conf
hrmm well you'll just have to be clever :)
heh :) smartass
setup a root passwd and see if it works..mine does
thats interesting
work out for ya?
i found a weird quirk, i've been trying to print test pages via gnome cups manager ... that only sends out a4, yet, i can print from other apps to 8.5x11 but not legal

i can change it to whatever i want
